IMDb data; ttnr: 0054094, Title: La morte-saison des amours, --- Description: La morte-saison des amours: Directed by Pierre Kast. With Françoise Arnoul, Daniel Gélin, Pierre Vaneck, Françoise Prévost. Sylvain, a suave, witty player as well as an accomplished writer and Genevieve met 10 months ago. He wanted a serious relationship for the first time so they moved to the country so they could be together and he could write." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0054094/","name":"La morte-saison des amours","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzFiMjczNTUtOWM0Yi00NDk0LThhY2ItZWQ3NDZhMDNhOTUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjE4NzY3Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sylvain, a suave, witty player as well as an accomplished writer and Genevieve met 10 months ago. He wanted a serious relationship for the first time so they moved to the country so they could be together and he could write.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0054094/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen","dateCreated":"2020-07-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Salty food for thought.","reviewBody":"The Saline Royale (Royal Saltworks) is a historical building at Arc-et-Senans eastern France,about 35 kilometers from Besançon. The architect was Claude-Nicolas Ledoux (1736-1806), whose career began under Louis the Fifteenth 's reign.This is the place where Pierre Kast,a former critic of the famous (or notorious ,depending on whom you ask) "cahiers du cinema" , locates his psychological drama dealing with the loves and times of privileged people ;his settings have always been his forte : the Royal Saltworks here , " Portugal in "vacances portugaises" , Brazil in " un animal doué de déraison" ,and mainly Easter Island in his most accessible film "les soleils de l'île de Pâques "....

If you expect pure Nouvelle Vague stuff ,this is exactly what you get : bourgeois people ,who have no problems to make both ends meet : they are in their desirable houses like in an ivory tower ,only concerned by their -insignificant - problems , les Salines -de -Chaux being like a fortress which cuts them from the world.

Sylvain ,a novelist who wrote a best-seller and since has been experimenting the writer's cramp ,lives with Geneviève , who , when she first appears ,holding a basket of vegetables ,asks herself what she is going to do today ;their neighbors are wealthy politicians :Jacques , nearing forty ,was once a prime minister (no less!) ,but sees time passing him by and longs for another life : ethnography , for instance , would allow him to go and study Easter Island (which the director would later use in his 1972 film);his numerous conquests (including Anne -Marie ,who seems to spend all her time horse-riding in the magnificent forest; a wasted Alexandra Stewart)do not satisfy him anymore .His wife Françoise is still ambitious and hard on the others (a typical NV female character who never had to earn her crust).

The well-read dialog is so sophisticated that the excellent actors (Daniel Gélin ,Pierre Vaneck ) have rather self-conscious manners ; the screenplay ,appallingly trite, (even the "ménage à trois" was not that original ;the very same year, Luis Bunuel ended his "Viridiana" that way), makes the viewer yawn his head off . It is the first time I have not liked Georges Delerue's score:his fanfare-like music is pompous and intrusive.

If you can relate to this kind of stuff ,there's more to enjoy in his "vacances portugaises " (1962) ;the subject is the same: wealthy people in a desirable mansion contemplating their navel ;and you will be treated to the delights of twelve people's sentimental problems.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":53,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"1961-06-12","keywords":"suave,witty,author,writer,countryside","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0036734/","name":"Françoise Arnoul","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004625/","name":"Daniel Gélin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0889005/","name":"Pierre Vaneck"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0440924/","name":"Pierre Kast"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0064459/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0440924/","name":"Pierre Kast"],"duration":"PT1H40M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Adorable menteuse
Adorable menteuse
programme.desc: Adorable menteuse: Directed by Michel Deville. With Marina Vlady, Macha Méril, Michel Vitold, Jean-Marc Bory. Juliette is a young woman who lies to everyone. She lies to all men she attracts with her womanly charms. But when she falls for an older man her reputation as a liar precedes her and she cannot convince him that he really does love him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0054603/","name":"Adorable menteuse","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGIwYzZlZDQtYjYzYy00YjRmLWEyYmQtNTc2OTY2ZGM2NTYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzNTE3NDA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Juliette is a young woman who lies to everyone. She lies to all men she attracts with her womanly charms. But when she falls for an older man her reputation as a liar precedes her and she cannot convince him that he really does love ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0054603/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"daniel-charles2"},"dateCreated":"2009-02-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Finger licking!","reviewBody":"In this early Deville movie, one finds already the lightness, the apparent frivolity which will still exists 40 years later in movies like Un monde si paisible. Adorable menteuse is the story of an archetypal airhead (hmm- yes, blonde), of her lies and not much else. Not much else apart from: being confronted with reality, the nature of joie de vivre, love and all that. It has the lightness of a soufflé. This sort of inconsequential story is of course the most difficult to tell, but Deville's sure hand avoids all the traps of sentimentality, and gives us a wonderful lesson in cinema. Seen four decades later, this movie acquires also the function of a time capsule: this was Paris in the early sixties, there was an air of joyful excitement which today's politically correct movies lack. Definitely a fingerlicking movie!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":198,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"1962-02-02","keywords":"blonde","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0900557/","name":"Marina Vlady"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0617736/","name":"Macha Méril"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0900062/","name":"Michel Vitold"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0222545/","name":"Michel Deville"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046889/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0173953/","name":"Nina Companeez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0222545/","name":"Michel Deville"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Barnacle Bill
Il était un petit navire
programme.desc:
Barnacle Bill: Directed by Charles Frend. With Alec Guinness, Harry Locke, Frederick Piper, Fred Griffiths. A seasick sea Captain commands an amusement pier despite local opposition." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0050168/","name":"Barnacle Bill","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTU0NDE1ZDMtMmQ0Yi00ODkyLWJlNGMtYTNjMmVhNzYyNGQ5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI4MjA5MzA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A seasick sea Captain commands an amusement pier despite local opposition.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0050168/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"aahamme"},"dateCreated":"2017-07-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoyable silliness","reviewBody":"Sir Alec was his usual fine self, and the story is enjoyably trite and silly, but the constant, odd fade-outs instead of proper scene endings makes one think that this was a victim of Ealing Studio's death. Few of the scenes are allowed to resolve themselves,while a few shots needed to be cut much shorter (the Ancestral Ghosts and their overlong, unfunny dance, for instance - 20 seconds would've been enough) leaving one to assume that many minutes of the story were trashed by Ealing's "mortician".

The story would have been well served if we could have seen a few positive effects upon the Town, when the Pier became a Ship. Just a few shots of people crowding into sad restaurants and seaside rooming houses, while they awaited a 'berth' on the Arabella, would have built much expectation and suspense. I bet that such scenes WERE filmed but later chopped, as there are several references to the Arabella bringing much business to the Town, but we never see that. 

I cannot recall another movie like this, where drama, dialogue, and music cues are cut-off by disturbing "fades-outs" of sound and picture. But if the MGM idiots (who also dumped its entire warehouse/library into pits along a highway) had anything to do with this, one should not be surprised.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1013,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"Unrated","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"1957-12-21","keywords":"pier,seasickness,arcade,cruise ship,english channel","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000027/","name":"Alec Guinness"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0516742/","name":"Harry Locke"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0684891/","name":"Frederick Piper"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0294243/","name":"Charles Frend"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040024/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0165021/","name":"T.E.B. Clarke"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

A seasick sea Captain commands an amusement pier despite local opposition." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0050168/","name":"Barnacle Bill","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTU0NDE1ZDMtMmQ0Yi00ODkyLWJlNGMtYTNjMmVhNzYyNGQ5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI4MjA5MzA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A seasick sea Captain commands an amusement pier despite local opposition.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0050168/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"aahamme","dateCreated":"2017-07-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoyable silliness","reviewBody":"Sir Alec was his usual fine self, and the story is enjoyably trite and silly, but the constant, odd fade-outs instead of proper scene endings makes one think that this was a victim of Ealing Studio's death. Few of the scenes are allowed to resolve themselves,while a few shots needed to be cut much shorter (the Ancestral Ghosts and their overlong, unfunny dance, for instance - 20 seconds would've been enough) leaving one to assume that many minutes of the story were trashed by Ealing's "mortician".

The story would have been well served if we could have seen a few positive effects upon the Town, when the Pier became a Ship. Just a few shots of people crowding into sad restaurants and seaside rooming houses, while they awaited a 'berth' on the Arabella, would have built much expectation and suspense. I bet that such scenes WERE filmed but later chopped, as there are several references to the Arabella bringing much business to the Town, but we never see that. 

I cannot recall another movie like this, where drama, dialogue, and music cues are cut-off by disturbing "fades-outs" of sound and picture. But if the MGM idiots (who also dumped its entire warehouse/library into pits along a highway) had anything to do with this, one should not be surprised.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1013,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"contentRating":"Unrated","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"1957-12-21","keywords":"pier,seasickness,arcade,cruise ship,english channel","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000027/","name":"Alec Guinness","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0516742/","name":"Harry Locke","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0684891/","name":"Frederick Piper"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0294243/","name":"Charles Frend"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040024/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0165021/","name":"T.E.B. programme.title: La taverne du poisson couronné
La taverne du poisson couronné
programme.desc: La taverne du poisson couronné: Directed by René Chanas. With Michel Simon, Jules Berry, Raymond Bussières, Blanchette Brunoy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0200201/","name":"La taverne du poisson couronné","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTVkMDc3ZWYtZTU2OS00MWI2LWI1MTEtMjJhZWY2ZWRkYjZkL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjM4NzIzNTE@._V1_.jpg","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0200201/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dbdumonteil"},"dateCreated":"2010-02-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Captain Lear","reviewBody":"There's good news: Michel Simon and Jules Berry in the same movie is always cause for celebration ;besides Blanchette Brunoy,generally cast as the nice young girl next door ,finds here an ambiguous part,which makes her look like king Lear's ungrateful daughter .\n\nBut there's also bad news ,which may account for the very low IMDb rating of the movie;the screenplay is rather weak and conventional,borrowing from many movies made before the war,from "Quai Des Brumes " to " Mollenard ,Capitaine Corsaire " (the ending of the latter is similar).Plus an interminable free-for-all in the tavern of the title (the crowned fish tavern)during which a murder is committed ."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":30,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"1947-12-10","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800302/","name":"Michel Simon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0077598/","name":"Jules Berry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0124482/","name":"Raymond Bussières"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0151200/","name":"René Chanas"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0151200/","name":"René Chanas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0291043/","name":"Nino Frank"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0419986/","name":"Henri Jeanson"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Le quai des brumes
Quai des brumes
programme.desc:
Le quai des brumes: Directed by Marcel Carné. With Jean Gabin, Michel Simon, Michèle Morgan, Pierre Brasseur. A military deserter finds love and trouble (and a small dog) in a smoky French port city." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0030643/","name":"Le quai des brumes","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAzMDMwMjgzMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTgzMTI0NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A military deserter finds love and trouble (and a small dog) in a smoky French port city.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0030643/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dbdumonteil"},"dateCreated":"2008-06-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"If we have lost the war.....","reviewBody":"...blame it on the "Quai des Brumes" !Both the right wing and the leftist reviews were chilly ,calling the movie " morbid" .Military censorship quickly banned "Le Jour se Lève" which was,if it were possible,even more depressing -and in my opinion even better,though at such a stratospheric level of art,this is minor quibble.

"You do not blame a barometer which forecasts the storm" was Carné's famous answer.

"Quai des Brumes" belongs to the legend of the French cinema.In a poll made around 1980,it was 8th best French film of all time (the number one,another Carné's masterpiece " Les Enfants Du Paradis" was a safe ,predictable choice ).More than the detective plot (there are many deaths in this film) ,the atmosphere of this misty harbor,with its ships about to sail away for these islands in the sun you'll never know ,is all that counts.It was the triumph of the Réalisme Poétique ,a label Carné himself did not like : these stories were poetic but they were not that much realistic,for they were filmed in studios ;masterpieces of cinema de studio of these golden years ,when the French were the best in the world : the harbor is unforgettable,as are the Canal Saint-Martin in "Hotel Du Nord" ,the metro station in "les Portes de la Nuit" or Le Boulevard Du Crime" in "Les Enfants Du Paradis".

After an odd effort -which is today considered ahead of its time- " Drôle De Drame" , " Quai Des Brumes" is actually the follow-up to "Jenny" (1936).The gallery of sinister-looking persons was already present in Carné's first movie,and Françoise Rosay's last lines indicated that the relatively optimistic ending would mute .

"Quai Des BRumes" leaves no hope to the viewer .This harbor which should mean freedom,escape is actually a blind alley ;nobody can escape.When Gabin appears in his shabby uniform and the gorgeous Michele Morgan in her raincoat and wearing her famous beret ,we know that their fate is already sealed.All the b.... around cannot understand true love .This is Carné's favorite subject: Michel Simon and Michèle Morgan are the prototype of the director's odd couple :see also Jules Berry and Jacqueline Laurent in "Le Jour Se Lève" or Pierre Brasseur and Nathalie Nattier in "Les Portes De La Nuit".

Extraordinary scenes: Michel Simon,playing loud classical music which becomes "exotic" in such a rotten world.The same ,crying his heart out for love which he has never known "Nobody loves me!" ;Nelly and Jean on the harbor,exchanging Prevert's haunting lines " Every time the sun rises ,we hope something fresh will be born,but when it goes down,it the same old gloomy world" "The bottom of the sea is full of rubbish" ;the opening scenes ,with this truck running through a foggy country .

All the endings of Carné's movies of that era are mind-boggling:from the sun rising as the tragedy is complete ("Le Jour Se Lève") to the still beating hearts ("Les Visiteurs Du Soir"),from Baptiste lost in the crowd ("Les Enfants Du Paradis" ) to the stunning editing which concludes "Quai Des Brumes" : Jean,Nelly,the ship,the dog ,all this ,more than the other endings had a strong influence on more movies I can think of: Yves Allegret 's "Dédée D'Anvers ",Carol Reed's "Odd man out" -also influenced by Duvivier 's 'Pepe le Moko" are two prominent examples.

We may have lost the war...but we have gained another masterpiece by one of our greatest directors and one of our greatest writers.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8661,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Crime","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1938-09-12","keywords":"port,male slaps a male,on the run,plan gone wrong,plan","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Port of Shadows","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1713289241","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDk1ZjMwNmQtNDkxYi00NDE3LWExMjEtZWRlY2NmNTFmMjRmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDk1ZjMwNmQtNDkxYi00NDE3LWExMjEtZWRlY2NmNTFmMjRmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Port of Shadows"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0300064/","name":"Jean Gabin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800302/","name":"Michel Simon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006807/","name":"Michèle Morgan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0138893/","name":"Marcel Carné"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005865/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0241409/","name":"Pierre Dumarchais"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0699535/","name":"Jacques Prévert"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Trials of Oscar Wilde
Les procès d'Oscar Wilde
programme.desc:
The Trials of Oscar Wilde: Directed by Ken Hughes. With Peter Finch, Yvonne Mitchell, James Mason, Nigel Patrick. A chronicle of Oscar Wilde's libel suit against the Marquis of Queensberry and the tragic turn his life takes because of it." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0054403/","name":"The Trials of Oscar Wilde","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWRjYzBjMDMtYWNkMi00YTIzLWE3MjUtYmQ1OTQ2YmMwNWNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjUyNDk2ODc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A chronicle of Oscar Wilde's libel suit against the Marquis of Queensberry and the tragic turn his life takes because of it.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0054403/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"pekinman"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's holding up very well after 40+ years","reviewBody":"Ken Hughes film 'The Trials of Oscar Wilde' may at first appear to be one of those cheesy Technicolor costume dramas when in fact it is a gripping and finely acted account of the appalling treatment Oscar Wilde received at the hands of the English justice system at the end of the 19th century.

Peter Finch is superb as the eponymous hero and is totally committed to the role and turns in one of his best performances on screen. The supporting cast is also quite good if more generalized in their characterizations, more a fault of the screenplay than the performers. There is one especially fine supporting performance from Lionel Jeffries as the maniacal Lord Queensbury. Jeffries plays Queensbury as a crazed brute, a type of man we can no longer countenance in these days, though I suspect they are still out there waiting for their chance to pounce on those who they fear and do not understand.

Sonia Dresdel is Lady Wilde, Oscar's dotty mother at the end of her life. It's a small part but is quietly powerful. Other people in Wilde's life, Constance, his wife, and Ada Leverson, his stalwart friend and life-long supporter, are tantalizingly glimpsed but little is revealed of their inner workings. But this isn't a film about them but about the actual trials and much of the film is spent in courtrooms. This might sound boring but it isn't.

James Mason appears in the first trial as the defending witness, for Lord Queensbury, and a more vicious, narrow-minded lawyer could hardly be found, even these days.

The technical credits are competent if nothing special; the music, melodramatic in a soap-opera-ish way, the sets plush and too clean. But somehow the power and tragedy of Wilde's story comes through all the gilding of the script, peppered with some of Wilde's wiser quotes, well-placed, naturally, in the text. There is nothing preachy or moralistic which is a relief, compared to the highly politicized scripts being written since this film was made.

It is interesting to note Nicholas Roeg as the camera operator. He wasn't the cinematographer but I detected a few Roeg-ish touches in a couple of the more meditative scenes.

This is not a film to be sluffed off as old-fashioned simply because there are no sex scenes or vulgar language or violence. The psychic violence suffered by Oscar Wilde was quite sufficient enough and this is a memorable film, worth having in the collection."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":888,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"keywords":"homophobia,homosexual history,based on true story,oscar wilde character,lord alfred douglas character","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002075/","name":"Peter Finch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0593814/","name":"Yvonne Mitchell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000051/","name":"James Mason"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0400731/","name":"Ken Hughes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103268/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103296/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0400731/","name":"Ken Hughes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0405007/","name":"Montgomery Hyde"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0299019/","name":"John Furnell"}],"duration":"PT2H3M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Scandal Sheet
L'inexorable enquête
programme.desc: Scandal Sheet: Directed by Phil Karlson. With Broderick Crawford, Donna Reed, John Derek, Rosemary DeCamp. The editor of an exploitation newspaper commits a murder and assigns his protégé to investigate hoping to divert attention away from himself." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0045124/","name":"Scandal Sheet","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE0MTkzMDYxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjUxNjIzMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The editor of an exploitation newspaper commits a murder and assigns his protégé to investigate hoping to divert attention away from himself.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0045124/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"olddiscs"},"dateCreated":"2007-08-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent Seldom seen Film Noir...","reviewBody":"Broderick Crawford stars in this exciting film noir from 1952..Fast paced & keeps viewer in suspense till the end..Excellent cast, including Crawford, handsome John Derek, intelligent beautiful, Donna Reed.and Harry Morgan..However..ROSEMARY DeCAMP, is outstanding in her brief but important scenes.. This is unlike her other screen work..Rosemary ,for me, steals the show!.Worth seeing ..Thanks again to TCM for showing this today on Broderick Crawfords day a fine, underrated actor . I started watching @ 20 minutes after film began ( I don't usually do this)and I was "hooked" as I saw Rosemary DeCamps close up at rally for "forlorn lovers" DeCamp recognizes Crawford ,her former husband, who has now changed his name and persona.. I stopped everything and could not stop watching till the end I wont tell you what happens.I hope TCM shows again soon so I can view the scenes I missed at the beginning","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2280,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"Passed","genre":["Crime","Drama","Film-Noir"],"datePublished":"1952-01-16","keywords":"taming of the shrew,dysfunctional marriage,manipulative female,manipulative wife,mother daughter relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Scandal Sheet","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2764028697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTk3NDQ3MWYtMzZiNy00Yjg5LTljZTQtOWJlNDhlMDRiZjNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTk3NDQ3MWYtMzZiNy00Yjg5LTljZTQtOWJlNDhlMDRiZjNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001135/","name":"John Derek"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001656/","name":"Donna Reed"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002024/","name":"Broderick Crawford"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0439597/","name":"Phil Karlson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0134950/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0792090/","name":"Ted Sherdeman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0512702/","name":"Eugene Ling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0688117/","name":"James Poe"}],"duration":"PT1H22M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Letter from an Unknown Woman
Lettre d'une inconnue
programme.desc: Letter from an Unknown Woman: Directed by Max Ophüls. With Joan Fontaine, Louis Jourdan, Mady Christians, Marcel Journet. A pianist about to flee from a duel receives a letter from a woman he cannot remember, who may hold the key to his downfall." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0040536/","name":"Letter from an Unknown Woman","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2VhMDdlM2UtYjViZi00OWFjLWI5YjUtYjY4NjRjOTJhOGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0MzMzNjA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A pianist about to flee from a duel receives a letter from a woman he cannot remember, who may hold the key to his downfall.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0040536/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"limshun"},"dateCreated":"2004-08-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Subversive Romance","reviewBody":"This has to be one of my all time favorite films. Ophuls is perhaps the most graceful and elegant film-maker ever. Here in Letter from an Unknown Woman, he is at his most romantic. Though the romance is only a fantasy (and so beautifully subverted by Ophuls graceful choreography and merciless sense of irony), passion is nevertheless king (or queen). I have never seen a film celebrate love in quite this way. It reminds me of one of the most beautiful lines in cinema from Altman's "Gosford Park" when Sophie Thompson says, "I believe in love. Not just getting it... giving it. I think as long as you can love somebody, whether or not they love you, then it's worth it." Ophuls' entire film plays with this very notion. Lise's fanatical love (and obsession) is requited not by Stefan but by Ophuls himself, and of course by weepy viewers like me and hopefully you too.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11664,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1948-07-16","keywords":"letter,unrequited love,pianist,duel,flashback","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Letter From An Unknown Woman","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1359939353","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2FhMGEzNmQtNjM5Zi00NDI4LTlhOTktOTMxY2U5MjgxODA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2FhMGEzNmQtNjM5Zi00NDI4LTlhOTktOTMxY2U5MjgxODA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for this love story"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000021/","name":"Joan Fontaine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431139/","name":"Louis Jourdan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0160130/","name":"Mady Christians"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0649097/","name":"Max Ophüls"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0151952/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0102256/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0462321/","name":"Howard Koch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0959003/","name":"Stefan Zweig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0649097/","name":"Max Ophüls"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Viva l'Italia
Viva l'Italia
programme.desc: Viva l'Italia: Directed by Roberto Rossellini. With Renzo Ricci, Paolo Stoppa, Franco Interlenghi, Giovanna Ralli. How Italy's historic national hero Giuseppe Garibaldi led a military campaign known as Expedition of the Thousand in 1860 and conquered Sicily and Naples." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0054447/","name":"Viva l'Italia","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2MyOTFhMTUtNDU1Yi00YmI2LWJiMjctOTAwYWYxNGU2NzFhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDYzNTI2ODc@._V1_.jpg","description":"How Italy's historic national hero Giuseppe Garibaldi led a military campaign known as Expedition of the Thousand in 1860 and conquered Sicily and Naples.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0054447/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"GregP89"},"dateCreated":"2015-02-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent Film..(the English 'dubbed' version) as I recall","reviewBody":"Excellent Film (the English 'dubbed' version) as I recall, in the Los Angeles / Southern California, region it was last shown on TV on KTLA (Channel 5) late night back in early 1980's. It is almost on par with Director David Leans' 'Lawrence of Arabia' and director Sergey Bondarchuk 'Waterloo' (Rod Steiger) as majestic Battlefield films capturing regalia, nationalistic unity, interwoven story lines, and excellent cinematography. To own a copy is a prize possession. That Director Vicente Minnelli was married to a US Entertainment icon did not deter him from paying tribute to his homeland (Italy) through this masterful film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":385,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","History"],"datePublished":"1961-02-02","keywords":"sicily invasion,nationalist,invasion,killing civilians,garibaldi","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0723242/","name":"Renzo Ricci"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0832375/","name":"Paolo Stoppa"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0409421/","name":"Franco Interlenghi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0744023/","name":"Roberto Rossellini"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0039837/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026813/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051441/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0024847/","name":"Sergio Amidei"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0678374/","name":"Antonio Petrucci"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0019530/","name":"Carlo Alianello"}],"duration":"PT2H9M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Return of the Seven
Le retour des sept
programme.desc: Return of the Seven: Directed by Burt Kennedy. With Yul Brynner, Robert Fuller, Julián Mateos, Warren Oates. Two survivors of the initial Magnificent Seven outfit, Chris and Vin, recruit four new members in order to re-form the outfit and defend a few Mexican villages from attacks by vicious bandits." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0060897/","name":"Return of the Seven","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWJjNTNhODUtZjBmZC00ZDdiLWI5ZjUtMmIxYWYxNzYyNDk3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxMTY0OTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two survivors of the initial Magnificent Seven outfit, Chris and Vin, recruit four new members in order to re-form the outfit and defend a few Mexican villages from attacks by vicious bandits.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0060897/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"csrothwec"},"dateCreated":"2010-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Have to agree with the majority of reviews; a boring remake","reviewBody":"If the 'Godfather II' was THE example of why a gifted director might consider making a sequel to a great film, this turkey is the classic counter-example of why no-one should make one (leaving aside the obvious point about wanting to milk a very successful cash cow a second time around). The only actor from the first (truly magnificent) film to appear is Yul Brynner in the lead role and all of the others who appear are decidedly 'B list' (if that) character actors who simply do not have the charisma to awaken much interest in their 'stories' or fates amongst the audience. Some attempts are made at repeating the original film's reflections on life and the transitoriness of glory/earthly admiration but in comparison with, say, Robert Vaughan's nightmares in the original film, these are stilted and unconvincing, whilst also being delivered (like most of the dialogue in the film) in a wooden, unenthusiastic manner. Even the gun fights/action scenes are poorly composed and almost totally 'flat'. The only things the film has going for it really are Bernstein's music (identical to the original) and the presence of Brynner, who could always carry a scene or, as in this case, even a whole film. I doubt if anyone would want to sit through a viewing of it more than once, though. I also suppose that one should be charitable, given what was to follow in the form of the two subsequent 'sequels' after this (by which time even Brynner had jumped ship), both of which were absolutely and totally dire, leaving the original template of a truly immortal Japanese film which underlay the whole enterprise entirely (and mercifully) forgotten.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4079,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"Unrated","genre":["Action","Western"],"datePublished":"1966-10-19","keywords":"two gun holster,gun holster,gun,holster,double gun holster","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1893122073","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGZkYjQxNzAtMDBiMi00MzNkLTkxYzMtNGVmZWMyNjYzODE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGZkYjQxNzAtMDBiMi00MzNkLTkxYzMtNGVmZWMyNjYzODE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000989/","name":"Yul Brynner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0298333/","name":"Robert Fuller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0558290/","name":"Julián Mateos"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0447944/","name":"Burt Kennedy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054562/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0064766/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0169540/","name":"Larry Cohen"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0060897, Title: Return of the Seven, --- Description: Return of the Seven: Directed by Burt Kennedy. With Yul Brynner, Robert Fuller, Julián Mateos, Warren Oates. Two survivors of the initial Magnificent Seven outfit, Chris and Vin, recruit four new members in order to re-form the outfit and defend a few Mexican villages from attacks by vicious bandits." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0060897/","name":"Return of the Seven","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWJjNTNhODUtZjBmZC00ZDdiLWI5ZjUtMmIxYWYxNzYyNDk3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxMTY0OTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two survivors of the initial Magnificent Seven outfit, Chris and Vin, recruit four new members in order to re-form the outfit and defend a few Mexican villages from attacks by vicious bandits.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0060897/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"csrothwec","dateCreated":"2010-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Have to agree with the majority of reviews; a boring remake","reviewBody":"If the 'Godfather II' was THE example of why a gifted director might consider making a sequel to a great film, this turkey is the classic counter-example of why no-one should make one (leaving aside the obvious point about wanting to milk a very successful cash cow a second time around). The only actor from the first (truly magnificent) film to appear is Yul Brynner in the lead role and all of the others who appear are decidedly 'B list' (if that) character actors who simply do not have the charisma to awaken much interest in their 'stories' or fates amongst the audience. Some attempts are made at repeating the original film's reflections on life and the transitoriness of glory/earthly admiration but in comparison with, say, Robert Vaughan's nightmares in the original film, these are stilted and unconvincing, whilst also being delivered (like most of the dialogue in the film) in a wooden, unenthusiastic manner. Even the gun fights/action scenes are poorly composed and almost totally 'flat'. The only things the film has going for it really are Bernstein's music (identical to the original) and the presence of Brynner, who could always carry a scene or, as in this case, even a whole film. I doubt if anyone would want to sit through a viewing of it more than once, though. I also suppose that one should be charitable, given what was to follow in the form of the two subsequent 'sequels' after this (by which time even Brynner had jumped ship), both of which were absolutely and totally dire, leaving the original template of a truly immortal Japanese film which underlay the whole enterprise entirely (and mercifully) forgotten.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4079,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5,"contentRating":"Unrated","genre":["Action","Western"],"datePublished":"1966-10-19","keywords":"two gun holster,gun holster,gun,holster,double gun holster","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1893122073","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGZkYjQxNzAtMDBiMi00MzNkLTkxYzMtNGVmZWMyNjYzODE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGZkYjQxNzAtMDBiMi00MzNkLTkxYzMtNGVmZWMyNjYzODE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000989/","name":"Yul Brynner","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0298333/","name":"Robert Fuller","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0558290/","name":"Julián Mateos"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0447944/","name":"Burt Kennedy"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054562/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0064766/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0169540/","name":"Larry Cohen"],"duration":"PT1H35M"</script><metacontent="

of a Colorado cattle baron, one biological and the other adopted, resent one another and fight for control of their father's cattle empire.","keywords":"whiskey,poker game,applejack,cigar smoking,cattle","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0044186/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bkoganbing"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Another somebody done somebody wrong picture","reviewBody":"Burt Lancaster usually played parts with a lot of depth to them, especially after From Here to Eternity. In fact other than Vengeance Valley, the only other film where he played a totally upright hero is Gunfight at the OK Corral.

He's the orphan kid that gets taken in by rancher Ray Collins who grows up and becomes foreman and companion to Robert Walker, Collins's real son. Walker is a spoiled kid and Lancaster is constantly cleaning up after him. Some of the same plot elements were used later in Man From Laramie and The Big Country. 

Walker is both coming home to his wife,Joanne Dru and another girl he's fathered a kid with, Sally Forrest. Lancaster is caught taking hush money over to Forrest by her no-account brothers, John Ireland and Hugh O'Brian. They come to the conclusion that Lancaster has done the deed. That's where the action starts.

Good western with some adult themes. Cattle drive scenes are tough and gritty, they don't have the epic quality of Red River, but are nicely done. The players all give a good account of themselves.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2070,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"duration":"PT1H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: De Dag
The Day
programme.desc: De Dag: With Jeroen Perceval, Liesa Van der Aa, Cedric Tylleman, Sofie Decleir. The nerve-racking events of a cold winter's day, seen from two different perspectives. The odd episodes tell the story of a team of police negotiators and special forces who respond to a hostage crisis in a small bank branch. The even episodes tell exactly the same events, only through the eyes of the criminals inside and their victims." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt6144672/","name":"De Dag","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTc4NTFhMzEtNDVhZi00ZWMzLWFjNTgtMjkxOTIxOWRkYTA3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTUxMzI3Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The nerve-racking events of a cold winter's day, seen from two different perspectives. programme.title: Cardinal
Cardinal
Cardinal
programme.sub-title: S3 E3 S3 E3 Jack
programme.desc: Cardinal: With Billy Campbell, Karine Vanasse, Kristen Thomson, Glen Gould. Cardinal struggles to right past wrongs that could derail his investigation and end his career, as the case grows more violent and twisted and the clock ticks down on the killer's next victim." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt5583512/","name":"Cardinal","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2EyMzQyYmYtOWYxNy00M2RjLTg4YmQtNDUyMzgzMDA3ZmQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjExMjk0ODk@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001004/","name":"Billy Campbell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0888468/","name":"Karine Vanasse"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0861038/","name":"Kristen Thomson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0029873/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0581999/"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Cardinal: Season 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2596519193","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmEwMmRjNTYtM2I0ZS00NDM3LTk4NDMtZWE3NjFkYzI0MzQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmEwMmRjNTYtM2I0ZS00NDM3LTk4NDMtZWE3NjFkYzI0MzQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Cardinal: Season 1"},"datePublished":"2017-01-26","description":"Cardinal struggles to right past wrongs that could derail his investigation and end his career, as the case grows more violent and twisted and the clock ticks down on the killer's next victim.","keywords":"character name as series title,surname as series title,set in canada,ontario canada,canadian culture","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5583512/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"zzholly"},"dateCreated":"2017-07-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cool Vibe","reviewBody":"I have to say, Canadian shows are catching my attention. It's the pacing as much as the quality of the production. American editing is a real problem for me as the scenes flick so fast I don't have time to take in the images and process to enjoy the emotions before you have to absorb the next image, and the next and next in split second action. I like lingering on a face (as long as you hired a real actor that is trained in the arts, not the couch) in order to capture what they are feeling. A technique that compensates for some lost book context if you have the right scene played out so you feel like you get inside their head. Non-American movies have always been attractive to me because of the more relaxed pacing that relies more upon acting. It's good to see this Canadian TV offerings as it captures you with a good story, moodiness and good character development. Except the young criminals. They are not as intense and believable as twisted, tortured beings. Next season will have new villains, and I hope they devote budget to those characters now that it's such a success. Also, perhaps second season bigger budget might mean more forensic realism and less relying on lingering dead body images. That's the one place I'd prefer the split-second images!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7599,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7}}</script><metacontent="

It's the pacing as much as the quality of the production. American editing is a real problem for me as the scenes flick so fast I don't have time to take in the images and process to enjoy the emotions before you have to absorb the next image, and the next and next in split second action. I like lingering on a face (as long as you hired a real actor that is trained in the arts, not the couch) in order to capture what they are feeling. A technique that compensates for some lost book context if you have the right scene played out so you feel like you get inside their head. Non-American movies have always been attractive to me because of the more relaxed pacing that relies more upon acting. It's good to see this Canadian TV offerings as it captures you with a good story, moodiness and good character development. Except the young criminals. They are not as intense and believable as twisted, tortured beings. Next season will have new villains, and I hope they devote budget to those characters now that it's such a success. skirt","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0144814/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"BigGuy","dateCreated":"1999-03-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Quite enjoyable","reviewBody":"I had read some bad reviews of this movie, that it didn't live up to the original and such. Having never seen the original I can't judge that. But I did have a good time with the movie. It isn't incredibly funny, or incredibly scary, but it does have a reality that made it a good movie. The characters were believable, even though many of them were off-the-shelf personalities. I especially liked the Romeo and Juliet touch that had undertones through the whole movie. enjoyable","reviewBody":"I had read some bad reviews of this movie, that it didn't live up to the original and such. Having never seen the original I can't judge that. But I did have a good time with the movie. It isn't incredibly funny, or incredibly scary, but it does have a reality that made it a good movie. The characters were believable, even though many of them were off-the-shelf personalities. I especially liked the Romeo and Juliet touch that had undertones through the whole movie. The only thing I would really ask to be changed in this movie is the last minute, being quite cliche for a horror movie.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15768,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7,"duration":"PT1H44M"</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 0173536, Title: La crim, --- Description: La crim': With Jean-François Garreaud, Didier Cauchy, Dominique Guillo, Teco Celio." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0173536/","name":"La crim'","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGEwMWUyNTEtNmJmMy00OTk5LWIwYmMtYWQzZTg2YTYyYmY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTcxMjI2NTA@._V1_.jpg","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0173536/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"peray_julien","dateCreated":"2006-08-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"A good show during the 9 first seasons.","reviewBody":"Hello, I'm French(sorry for the orthographies errors), and I like this show. 6 detectives of the Criminal Police at the 36, Quai des Orfèvres in Paris, investigate on murders. The detectives are:

Françoise Galliot(played by Clotilde de Bayser)(season 1;2;3;4) is the chief of the team. She is a very authoritative woman. She is a good friend of Scandella.

Hélène Vallon(played by Isabel Otéro)(season 5;6;7;8;9) is the second chief of the team after Galliot's departure.

Jean-Louis Scandella(played by Didier Cauchy): He is a good friend of Paulo and Françoise, and he felt in love with Caroline, and after with Vallon the 2nd chief. He become the new chief after Vallons 'departure.

Michel Lemarchand(played by Jean-François Garreaud): A very mystery man.

Paul "Paulo" Maureau(played by Teco Celio): The best friend of Scandella

Alexandre "Sisko" Siskowski(played by Dominique Guillo): A young detective.

Caroline Tessier(played by Agathe de La Boulaye)(episodes 1-13). She was in love with Scandella but she was murdered.

And more... I think the show was good during the 9 first seasons when Galliot, and after Vallon, was the chief of team. After that Hélène Vallon left the team, the show was not as much so good.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":49,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6,"genre":["Crime"],"datePublished":"1999-06-11","keywords":"paris france,quai des orfevres,investigation","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0308036/","name":"Jean-François Garreaud","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0146447/","name":"Didier Cauchy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0347123/","name":"Dominique Guillo"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074460/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011107/"]</script><metacontent="

family","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0414951/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"kenningtonr","dateCreated":"2005-09-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"A distressing but well executed film","reviewBody":"This film receives a 10 for disturbing subject matter. It is at times very difficult to watch. The characters are troubled, each in his/her own way. It feels edgy and often very foreign. With that warning, I must say that on some level I enjoyed the film. Technically it is superb. The character development is wonderful, the story intriguing and the plot is gripping. As the plot unfolds, you are forced to change your opinions about each of the characters. At first I despised the main character but felt much sympathy for her towards the end. Not an uplifting film, but that is certainly not what the screenwriter nor the director intended. I suspect that it will be an award winner.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15959,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"duration":"PT1H36M"</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 0115355, Title: Silent Witness, --- Description: Silent Witness: With Emilia Fox, William Gaminara, Tom Ward, David Caves. Crimes through the eyes of a team of forensic pathologists and forensic scientists." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0115355/","name":"Silent Witness","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmFjNmI4OGItZDc4Yi00MDkxLWFkNjctODliNTI1ODU1NTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjY0NzE3NzQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Crimes through the eyes of a team of forensic pathologists and forensic scientists.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0115355/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"m_winship","dateCreated":"2019-05-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Raise your eye brow!","reviewBody":"How could I've missed this Brit Drama for 21 seasons! Hell, that's just a little under my age, cough, cough. In all seriousness, I've been fixated on British and Aussie crime dramas lately as American acting has been abysmal lately you see. The big thing I like about the Brits is their clever repartee and mannerisms. Remember the Connery eye brow move? You see! Well, I'm off to the first season, and first episode...so see ya in 21 years! Cheers! programme.desc: Blindspot: Created by Martin Gero. With Sullivan Stapleton, Jaimie Alexander, Audrey Esparza, Ashley Johnson. Jane Doe is found in Times Square with no memory and mysterious tattoos on her body." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt4474344/","name":"Blindspot","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDIyYzUwNjgtNDA1Mi00ZmQ3LThhNWQtN2RjZjczNjRlZmQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjMxNzcwOTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jane Doe is found in Times Square with no memory and mysterious tattoos on her body.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4474344/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jslawrenc"},"dateCreated":"2015-09-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pleasantly Surprised","reviewBody":"I'd actually give this an 8.5, but decided to round up vs. down to counter balance some of the negative recent reviews submitted by others. I thought Jaimie Alexander was great and demonstrated her talent in this role more than I've seen from her in past roles such as Thor and The Brink. Sullivan Stapleton's acting was admittedly a little wooden in the pilot, but I liked his tough guy persona in Strike Back & think he'll grow into this role with time also. Yes, the story line is completely far-fetched and unrealistic. Yes, the plot does borrow from different formulas we've seen before, but not in a way that's a total rip off from other movies or TV. It doesn't have the originality of Mr Robot or the grittiness of True Detective, but it's fun popcorn entertainment. If you put Bourne Identity, Blacklist and Momento into a blender, you'd end up Blindspot!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":68608,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-09-21","keywords":"tattoo,martial arts,tattooed woman,one woman army,fbi agent","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0822982/","name":"Sullivan Stapleton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1526352/","name":"Jaimie Alexander"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4383492/","name":"Audrey Esparza"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0540475/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330789/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005035/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1236625/","name":"Martin Gero"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"New York Comic Con Season 3 Sneak Peek","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1315879193","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjc3YjYwNmQtZjNhYi00Nzk4LWE3OGItMjIzODA1M2U4YmM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM4OTI2MTU@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjc3YjYwNmQtZjNhYi00Nzk4LWE3OGItMjIzODA1M2U4YmM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM4OTI2MTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cast of "Blindspot" had a blast when they returned to New York Comic Con with an appearance this weekend. Fans at the packed Hammerstein Ballroom had the chance to chat with series stars Sullivan Stapleton, Jaimie Alexander, Rob Brown, Audrey Esparza, Ashley Johnson, Luke Mitchell and fan-favorite guest star Ennis Esmer, as well as executive producer Martin Gero, and were treated to an exclusive highlight reel that takes a sneak peek look at Season 3 - with a two-year time jump and a brand-new set of bioluminescent puzzle tattoos! Blindspot premieres Friday, October 27th at 8/7c on NBC."}}</script><metacontent="

Yes, the story line is completely far-fetched and unrealistic. Yes, the plot does borrow from different formulas we've seen before, but not in a way that's a total rip off from other movies or TV. It doesn't have the originality of Mr Robot or the grittiness of True Detective, but it's fun popcorn entertainment. known as the "Ship of Death" in the deserts of West Africa while helping a WHO doctor being hounded by a ruthless dictator.","keywords":"beach,evil man,good versus evil,bare chested male,disguise","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0318649/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"stevetseitz"},"dateCreated":"2005-04-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Succeeds in what it tries to do","reviewBody":"Bring on Dirk Pitt! Here is a movie that wants to have fun, the cast wants to have fun. The audience ends up having fun. Steve Zahn is hilarious. Matthew McConaughey handles the limited demands of his role quite well. Penelope Cruz brings her ever-present charm and beauty to a role which is notable for being one of the few action-adventure roles written for a female that is not obnoxious in recent memory. You can't take your eyes off William H. Macy whenever he is on screen in ANY movie. He's that good.\n\nIt's kind of a Bond meets Indiana Jones film (I swear they used the same canyon from "Raiders of the Lost Ark") The villains are one dimensional, but who cares? We are here to follow the exploits of our heroes. If we have to suspend our disbelief, we do it willingly because we are grinning ear to ear.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":93976,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 4474344, Title: Blindspot, --- Description: Blindspot: Created by Martin Gero. With Sullivan Stapleton, Jaimie Alexander, Audrey Esparza, Ashley Johnson. Jane Doe is found in Times Square with no memory and mysterious tattoos on her body." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt4474344/","name":"Blindspot","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDIyYzUwNjgtNDA1Mi00ZmQ3LThhNWQtN2RjZjczNjRlZmQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjMxNzcwOTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jane Doe is found in Times Square with no memory and mysterious tattoos on her body.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4474344/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jslawrenc","dateCreated":"2015-09-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pleasantly Surprised","reviewBody":"I'd actually give this an 8.5, but decided to round up vs. down to counter balance some of the negative recent reviews submitted by others. I thought Jaimie Alexander was great and demonstrated her talent in this role more than I've seen from her in past roles such as Thor and The Brink. Sullivan Stapleton's acting was admittedly a little wooden in the pilot, but I liked his tough guy persona in Strike Back & think he'll grow into this role with time also. Yes, the story line is completely far-fetched and unrealistic. Yes, the plot does borrow from different formulas we've seen before, but not in a way that's a total rip off from other movies or TV. It doesn't have the originality of Mr Robot or the grittiness of True Detective, but it's fun popcorn entertainment. If you put Bourne Identity, Blacklist and Momento into a blender, you'd end up Blindspot!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":68608,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-09-21","keywords":"tattoo,martial arts,tattooed woman,one woman army,fbi agent","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0822982/","name":"Sullivan Stapleton","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1526352/","name":"Jaimie Alexander","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4383492/","name":"Audrey Esparza"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0540475/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330789/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005035/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1236625/","name":"Martin Gero"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"New York Comic Con Season 3 Sneak Peek","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1315879193","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjc3YjYwNmQtZjNhYi00Nzk4LWE3OGItMjIzODA1M2U4YmM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM4OTI2MTU@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjc3YjYwNmQtZjNhYi00Nzk4LWE3OGItMjIzODA1M2U4YmM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM4OTI2MTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cast of "Blindspot" had a blast when they returned to New York Comic Con with an appearance this weekend. Fans at the packed Hammerstein Ballroom had the chance to chat with series stars Sullivan Stapleton, Jaimie Alexander, Rob Brown, Audrey Esparza, Ashley Johnson, Luke Mitchell and fan-favorite guest star Ennis Esmer, as well as executive producer Martin Gero, and were treated to an exclusive highlight reel that takes a sneak peek look at Season 3 - with a two-year time jump and a brand-new set of bioluminescent puzzle tattoos! Blindspot premieres Friday, October 27th at 8/7c on NBC."</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Blindspot: Created by Martin Gero. With Sullivan Stapleton, Jaimie Alexander, Audrey Esparza, Ashley Johnson. Jane Doe is found in Times Square with no memory and mysterious tattoos on her body." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt4474344/","name":"Blindspot","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDIyYzUwNjgtNDA1Mi00ZmQ3LThhNWQtN2RjZjczNjRlZmQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjMxNzcwOTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Jane Doe is found in Times Square with no memory and mysterious tattoos on her body.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4474344/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jslawrenc"},"dateCreated":"2015-09-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pleasantly Surprised","reviewBody":"I'd actually give this an 8.5, but decided to round up vs. down to counter balance some of the negative recent reviews submitted by others. I thought Jaimie Alexander was great and demonstrated her talent in this role more than I've seen from her in past roles such as Thor and The Brink. Sullivan Stapleton's acting was admittedly a little wooden in the pilot, but I liked his tough guy persona in Strike Back & think he'll grow into this role with time also. Yes, the story line is completely far-fetched and unrealistic. Yes, the plot does borrow from different formulas we've seen before, but not in a way that's a total rip off from other movies or TV. It doesn't have the originality of Mr Robot or the grittiness of True Detective, but it's fun popcorn entertainment. If you put Bourne Identity, Blacklist and Momento into a blender, you'd end up Blindspot!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":68608,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-09-21","keywords":"tattoo,martial arts,tattooed woman,one woman army,fbi agent","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0822982/","name":"Sullivan Stapleton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1526352/","name":"Jaimie Alexander"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4383492/","name":"Audrey Esparza"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0540475/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330789/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005035/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1236625/","name":"Martin Gero"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"New York Comic Con Season 3 Sneak Peek","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1315879193","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjc3YjYwNmQtZjNhYi00Nzk4LWE3OGItMjIzODA1M2U4YmM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM4OTI2MTU@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjc3YjYwNmQtZjNhYi00Nzk4LWE3OGItMjIzODA1M2U4YmM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM4OTI2MTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cast of "Blindspot" had a blast when they returned to New York Comic Con with an appearance this weekend. Fans at the packed Hammerstein Ballroom had the chance to chat with series stars Sullivan Stapleton, Jaimie Alexander, Rob Brown, Audrey Esparza, Ashley Johnson, Luke Mitchell and fan-favorite guest star Ennis Esmer, as well as executive producer Martin Gero, and were treated to an exclusive highlight reel that takes a sneak peek look at Season 3 - with a two-year time jump and a brand-new set of bioluminescent puzzle tattoos! Blindspot premieres Friday, October 27th at 8/7c on NBC."}}</script><metacontent="

A group of high school teenagers and their parents attempt to navigate the many ways the Internet has changed their relationships, their communications, their self-images, and their love lives." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3179568/","name":"Men, Women & Children","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAwMzc2OTgwOTZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDg2ODA4NjIx._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3239803/","name":"Kaitlyn Dever"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1679669/","name":"Rosemarie DeWitt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5052065/","name":"Ansel Elgort"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0718646/","name":"Jason Reitman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0280848/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2226753/","name":"Chad Kultgen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0718646/","name":"Jason Reitman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933379/","name":"Erin Cressida Wilson"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2494279449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0ODkxMDI5MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDczOTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0ODkxMDI5MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDczOTIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Men, Women and Children follows the story of a group of high school teenagers and their parents as they attempt to navigate the many ways the internet has changed their relationships, their communication, their self-image, and their love lives. The film attempts to stare down social issues such as video game culture, anorexia, infidelity, fame hunting, and the proliferation of illicit material on the internet. As each character and each relationship is tested, we are shown the variety of roads people choose - some tragic, some hopeful - as it becomes clear that no one is immune to this enormous social change that has come through our phones, our tablets, and our computers."},"datePublished":"2014-10-17","description":"A group of high school teenagers and their parents attempt to navigate the many ways the Internet has changed their relationships, their communications, their self-images, and their love lives.","keywords":"sex scene,oral sex,black panties,masturbation,teenage girl","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3179568/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sjanzeir"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"A zero-sum film.","reviewBody":"The film is a messy, chaotic mishmash of sub-plots that predictably fail to amalgamate into one overall, coherent plot. Though little is resolved at the end, the movie isn't a complete waste of time, if only for the pleasure of seeing Adam Sandler play a normal human being for a change. The film tries to be a cautionary tale both for and against the Internet and its misuse, abuse, and overuse, but it fails both ways, and ends up canceling itself out. It tries to remind us that despite the internet - or, perhaps because of it - we are still real, live human beings, with flesh and blood and wants and needs and desires and lusts and fears and angst, but we already knew that since about 2004, so it's about a decade too late.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31127,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mon frère Yves
Mon frère Yves
programme.desc: Mon frère Yves: Directed by Patrick Poivre d'Arvor. With Thierry Frémont, Jérôme Kircher, Jacques Spiesser, Agnès Delachair. À travers le récit dune fraternité presque amoureuse, ou dun amour fraternel, orageux et passionnés, Julien VIAUD (alias Pierre LOTI), officier de marine, se donne un frère de substitution : le matelot Yves KERMADEC Dun côté, le naturel, le côté fruste et primaire dYves qui sait à peine lire et écrire, et de lautre lambiguité, lextravagance, le raffinement, la supériorité hiérarchique et sociale, le prestige de la culture et de la connaissance, qui sont la marque de Pierre. Les pires dangers qui menacent Yves sont moins les périls inhérents à la mer en général et à son métier de gabier en particulier, que les risques liés à la terre, et surtout à ces bouges à matelots qui lattirent irrésistiblement, et où il senivre au point de devenir un autre homme, un être pétri de fureur et de violence. Sa chance, cest davoir croisé la route de LOTI qui a juré à la mère dYves quil veillerait toujours sur ce dernier comme sur un frère : il va non seulement éviter à son « frère » Yves de se perdre tout à fait, mais il laidera à se construire en tant quhomme, à fonder une famille, à bâtir sa maison. Il va laimer mais ce terme peut revêtir tant de sens différents, quil faudra à LOTI toute une vie pour faire la part des choses entre aimer et aimer Mon frère Yves insistera sur une notion universelle contenue dans le roman : celui-ci est avant tout un formidable récit dinitiation. Quand elles sont aussi consolantes, les histoires de la vie, conclut Pierre LOTI dans son roman, devraient pouvoir être arrêtées à volonté comme celles des livres. Ou celles des films, ajouterons-nous." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2158643/","name":"Mon frère Yves","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA3MDMyOTU3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDk1NjM2MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"À travers le récit dune fraternité presque amoureuse, ou dun amour fraternel, orageux et passionnés, Julien VIAUD (alias Pierre LOTI), officier de marine, se donne un frère de substitution : le matelot Yves KERMADEC\n\nDun côté, le nat","aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-07-17","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0297004/","name":"Thierry Frémont"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0456268/","name":"Jérôme Kircher"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0818686/","name":"Jacques Spiesser"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0688650/","name":"Patrick Poivre d'Arvor"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0122422/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0213939/","name":"Didier Decoin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0521464/","name":"Pierre Loti"}]}</script><metacontent="

This film teaches us not to be hooked on making our life close to those misty-eyed soap-operas. All romantic stories definitely can't contain only something good. Not the best, but a good film.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1622,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8,"genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2010-05-05","keywords":"deafness,handicap,character says i love you,cell phone,telephone call","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi369146393","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTVhNTFlYzMtMjA4NC00NmQ1LWIyMWItNjU5ODcyNGZjMzQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTVhNTFlYzMtMjA4NC00NmQ1LWIyMWItNjU5ODcyNGZjMzQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0180404/","name":"Clovis Cornillac","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1812637/","name":"Virginie Efira","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2176554/","name":"Manu Payet"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268543/","name":"Dominique Farrugia","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0501548/","name":"Arnaud Lemort"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183761/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0239498/","name":"Franck Dubosc","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0501548/","name":"Arnaud Lemort"],"duration":"PT1H40M"</script><metacontent="
